**TL;DR**

The US Treasury yield curve remains inverted for 739 days as of July 10, 2024, with notable spreads between the 2 Year-10 Year and 3 Month-10 Year yields. An inverted curve often signals economic concerns, yet the SPY ETF has shown resilience, rising to $561.32 amid declining inflation, as per the recent CPI report. The Federal Reserve maintains its focus on a 2% inflation target and maximum employment, keeping rates steady at 5.25%-5.5%. Despite easing inflation, the Fed remains cautious, monitoring economic data closely before adjusting policies. Meanwhile, market optimism is growing, reflecting bets on potential rate cuts and investments in riskier assets, driven by hopes of sooner inflation control measures easing.
